channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple wood pallets dumped on the green next to 25 Martaban Road, 12th August
item.description:
Multiple wood pallets have been dumped on the green next to 25 Martaban Road. I have seen staff from the supermarket 1010 on 4 Manor Road bringing these wood pallets from their supermarket to dump them on the green next to 25 Martaban Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martaban Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle parked for months, 12th August
item.description:
The vehicle in the picture, and its owner(s), are causing concern since it has not moved in around 3 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakleigh Crescent, Brunswick Park, London

item.title: Fly tipping in this area all the time, 12th August
item.description:
Every day there is fly tipping problem here. It is disgusting. Please put a camera here to sort it out. It’s not nice for us residents to see and be woken up by the noise.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villa Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cranley Gardens - flytipping 2nd day running, 12th August
item.description:
12/8 - outside 42/44 Cranley Gardens - same flat flytipping large amounts of packaging in front of cars on pavement. Unacceptable and not putting in correct basement bin cupboards provided. Order paper on one packaging saying ‘Miss Alexandra’ - RBK&C council please cross reference against council tax records to see if persuade. Is at 42 or 44 Cranley Gardens and can be fined.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Cranley Gardens, Brompton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris from crashed car, 12th August
item.description:
The left overs from crashed car still heaped up against tree outside 18 Greenways, Beckenham part on pavement and part on road with shattered glass and remains of car bumper, head lights etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping of rubbish and shopping trolleys, 12th August
item.description:
Dummping of shopping trolley and rubbish in this part of the street rd has become a common acurance its bring rats and flys this is health hazard this is nit fear for the resident s of the rd and businesses as we paye our council taxs this is not right and not fear please can this isdie be address. thank you in advanced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Marischal Road, Hither Green, London

item.title: Fly tipping on street, 12th August
item.description:
Batwa house constantly puts their rubbish on the street and their bins are over-flowing. They have now piled rubbish, wood and cardboard boxes on the street. This attracts foxes and rats and is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Varcoe Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated noise and exhaust pollution from classic car on Stoke Newington Church Street, 12th August
item.description:
A red classic Ford Mustang regularly parks on the West side of Church Street. Multiple times a week, the engine is revved excessively, creating very high noise levels and the exhaust produces a strong smell of unburnt petrol, which drifts into my flat.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large number of bin bags piled in the car park behind the high street for months., 12th August
item.description:
The large pile of black bin bags piled up in the car park at the junction between The Drive and the Beckenham High Street (Next to the cafe shop) for months. With temperature rising, the smell is unbearable and it attacks large number of flies and rats during the day and night . There seems no incentive of having the rubbish removed from the premise. One can catch the horrible smell from the high street and from The Drive . It was horrible .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
